column4: hi. howto turn off flash? as it slow down my ubuntu. i used to rename .mozilla/plugin--off now this folder does not exit
i find this 8.04.2 so different. it made me hard
When it comes to flash, I prefer using the purge command, but that's just me.
and why would you need to rename it in the first place?
In the location bar, type about:config. Search for "plugins" in the filter and you should see one that says "expose full path." Double click that to set it to true
not found: expose full path ?
about:config -> plugins
plugin.expose_full_path
it is false, set to true ? what will happen if true ?
When you set it to true, and go back into about:plugins it will show you exactly where the installed copy of flash is sitting.
ok
ok set to true, now what ?
what's next step ?
You mentioned flash is still installed and you want to get rid of it, yes?
try to turn off, if not, try to get rid of it -- the d thing
Okay, yeah, go into about:plugins now, and tell us where that copy of flash (libflashplayer.so) is sitting.
File name: /usr/lib/adobe-flashplugin/libflashplayer.so
That's from the official package. If you're having trouble getting rid of it via the terminal, go into Synaptic and search for it.
seems gone now :D
FF by default installed lots of other plugin: most of them video player. should i remove them as well ?
A lot of those plugins are components of other packages. I wouldn't bother hunting them all down unless they're causing problems.
ok
thanks :)
no problem
